reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Delightful Read
reviews.reviewText: The Filigree Master’s Apprentice, set in late nineteenth-century Porto, Portugal, is a treasure. English-language readers are inundated with books set in England and the United States. How special to be able to read about an unfamiliar time and place. The author has thoroughly researched the book, and we learn splendid, fascinating, and sordid details about life in Porto. Henrique, a 17 year old from the Douro wine region, seeks a better life as an apprentice to a filigree maker in Porto. He must skillfully navigate not only the Douro River to get to Porto, but also on his arrival the jealousy and machinations of a would-be apprentice, Hugo. The completion and inauguration of the Eiffel bridge, a symbol of the city’s industrial and cultural progress, fills the city with excitement. Henrique associates the new bridge with his new life. When he learns of a possible plot to destroy the bridge and the royal family who will be attending the inauguration ceremony, he must act. I thoroughly enjoyed Rossio Square N.°59, Jeannine Johnson’s first historical novel set in Lisbon during World War Two. She is a skillful, thoughtful writer and her new novel will not disappoint.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book kept me in suspense, I couldn't put the book down it was a excellent fast read! Can't see what the author comes up with next.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This should be on the reading list for Douro River trips!
reviews.reviewText: I loved learning about the history of Douro River and Porto people. The context of the characters made the story come alive and really got me in the mood for my first trip to Porto and the river next week. I can’t wait to walk the historic streets, bridges, and travel up the river.

reviews.reviewTitle: Helpful— but not necessary— to have some knowledge of the terrain of the Porto and Gaia area.
reviews.reviewText: This book is a thoroughly enjoyable read. I liked the anticipation of upcoming events throughout the whole story. It’s gives a vivid picture of what it was like in 1877 Porto and peoples’ challenges to survive.There was nothing about this book that I disliked.I look forward to Jeannine Johnson Maia’s next novel. She is a master writer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Step into the vibrant tapestry of 19th-century Portugal with "The Filigree Master's Apprentice." This captivating narrative introduces Henrique, a young man eager to escape a past marked by betrayal. His odyssey leads him to Porto, a city poised on the cusp of transformation, symbolized by the magnificent Douro River bridge. In this novel, history and imagination entwine seamlessly, immersing readers in a world pulsating with life. With its intriguing characters and a narrative brimming with suspense, the book beckons to those seeking historical fiction infused with emotion and authenticity.

The Filigree Master's Apprentice" is a captivating tale set in 19th-century Portugal. It introduces us to Henrique, a young man seeking a fresh start in Porto, leaving behind a past scarred by betrayal. As he ventures into this vibrant city, he discovers the art of filigree-making and becomes entangled in a web of intrigue, endangering both his new life and the iconic Douro River bridge. The book skilfully blends history with fiction, immersing readers in the sights and emotions of the era. With compelling characters and a suspenseful plot, it's a must-read for those who crave historical fiction with depth and heart.
